properties.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Northeast Johnson County
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 2 at 5:03AM MST until February 4 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Major Winter Storm is expected this Afternoon through Monday
Night...

.A cold front move into northern Wyoming late this morning. This
cold front will drop southward to the Continental Divide by around
sunset, and then move into southwest Wyoming tonight. The snow
is expected to occur in the north this afternoon and progress
south tonight. This storm system will impact most areas through
Monday evening, then taper off late Monday night. The heaviest
snowfall looks to occur tonight through Monday afternoon.

* WHAT...Moderate to Heavy snow.

* WHERE...Bighorn Mountains West, Bighorn Mountains Southeast
and Northeast Johnson County.

* WHEN...From noon Sunday to 5 AM MST Tuesday.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...6 to 12 inches in the lower elevations. Snowfall
of 12 to 20 inches in the mountains with the heaviest amounts
on the eastern slopes.

* IMPACTS...Travel may be very difficult tonight and Monday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North wind of 20 to 30 mph will cause
blowing and drifting snow. Interstates 25 and 90 will be
severely impacted by this storm.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 AM MST TUESDAY
